titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1362) to reform acquisition practices of the Federal Government.
Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1362) to reform acquisition practices of the Federal Government.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-49, by Ms. Castor.

In lieu of the amendments recommended by the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform and the Committee on Armed Services now printed in the bill, it shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute printed in part A of the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution. All points of order against that amendment in the nature of a substitute are waived except those arising under clauses 9 or 10 or rule XXI.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 26.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 242.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 223 - 190 (Roll no. 154).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 1362 (Accountability in Contracting Act).
